item.title: Obsnapper
item.description: I made this bash script for window snapping function under Openbox. I made this for practicing bash and for my personal use. I don’t plan on taking feature requests or whatever. However, It works for me, so I decided to share this as a project. I’m using this script under Ubuntu 14.04 with Openbox 3.5.2 and tint2 0.11+svn20121014 at resolution 1366x768 and 1280x800. Features Window snapping to left and right Restoring window position or restoring window to a fixed position Dependencies xwininfo xprop wmctrl using a panel or dock with openbox Configurable options PANEL_NAME="" (string ; name of the panel or dock ; for example: tint2) PANEL_ID="" (string ; only if PANEL_NAME is not working ; for example: 0x40006b) PANEL_TYPE="" (string ; options: left, top, bottom) PX_CORR_LPT= (integer ; some pixel correction, mainly beacause of borders ; you can use this when PANEL_TYPE is set to “left” ; for example: 2) RESTORE_BEHAVIOUR="" (string ; options: dynamic, fixed) TOP_MARGIN= (integer ; margin from the top (in pixel), when RESTORE_BEHAVIOUR is set to “fixed” ; for example: 10) Notes: Do not use quotation marks ("") with integer type options!
